TopicTitle: How much do you guys care about the science?

Articles.Content: So I've been happily playing KSP Career mode and have gotten quite far. Then I realised that I didn't actually recover 100% science from each area. Now a half of me wants to go back and get collect the last scrapes of science points while the other half of me is too lazy to do so. What about you guys? and what do you think I should do? Get 100% science or just forget about the small percentage left over?
Well seeing as science currently has no real value once the tech tree is filled out, I don't tend to worry about it.
After a couple of hours its just a sandbox game.

I hate to admit it, but all I care about is money these days. You can't collect science without funds. I have every piece of scientific data gathering equipment unlucked, and I get every bit of science I can, and physically take it back to Kerbin if it isn't 100% worth transmitting; but at the end of the day, I won't be launching any rockets if there's moths flying out of my pockets.

Hey that rhymed...
There's lots of science to be had around Kerbin, Mun and Minmus; don't sweat it. Don't even bother with it once you've got the parts you need unlocked, unless you're getting paid for it.

I don't really care about science because I'm playing sandbox and I like it a whole lot more. Playing career, that science thing kinda screwed up my whole game because I wasn't doing missions just for fun or building stations, visiting other planets or something like that, I was just thinking like "GAATHER ALL THE SCIEEEENCE!!!!!!" and I didn't want to spend my whole life flying here and there just to get every piece of science to complete the tech tree or at least some necessary parts of it.

As I care for the science I play the scinece mode. Also I have the tech tree complete I still have a "measurable" goal for my missions.

But normally I'm satisfied with a report from each side. I do not aim for 100% coverage.
